intro: Anemone tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan anemone, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces a basal rosette of foliage. Anemone tibetica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable growing conditions.
